Now that Google and Twitter have taken responsible steps to guard against shadowy political influence campaigns, Facebook should do the same instead of continuing to chase political advertising dollars at the expense of keeping Americans safe.

The fact that Facebook’s ad transparency tools don’t apply to services like Custom Audiences, is especially concerning and makes it impossible for voters to know why they are being targeted with ad campaigns.

Google’s decision to stop microtargeting political ads is a step toward safeguarding our elections against foreign interference. In October, I said that targeted influence campaigns are more effective than blanket propaganda, and far harder to identify and expose.
